verses.kjv: At that time, saith the LORD, they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of his princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves:
verses.ct: "When that time comes," declares the LORD, "the bones of Judah's kings, its officials, the priests, the prophets, and the people of Jerusalem will be dug up from their graves."

verses.kjv: And they shall spread them before the sun, and the moon, and all the host of heaven, whom they have loved, and whom they have served, and after whom they have walked, and whom they have sought, and whom they have worshipped: they shall not be gathered, nor be buried; they shall be for dung upon the face of the earth.
verses.ct: They will be scattered out under the sun, the moon, and all the stars of heaven — the very things they loved, served, followed, consulted, and worshiped. No one will collect them or rebury them. They will lie like manure on the surface of the earth.

verses.kjv: And death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residue of them that remain of this evil family, which remain in all the places whither I have driven them, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: Everyone who survives from this wicked nation — wherever I have scattered them — will prefer death over life," declares the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: Moreover thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the LORD; Shall they fall, and not arise? shall he turn away, and not return?
verses.ct: "Also tell them this: The LORD says, 'When people fall down, don't they get back up? When someone wanders off, don't they find their way back?'

verses.kjv: Why then is this people of Jerusalem slidden back by a perpetual backsliding? they hold fast deceit, they refuse to return.
verses.ct: So why have the people of Jerusalem turned away and never stopped turning away? They cling to their lies and refuse to come back.

verses.kjv: I hearkened and heard, but they spake not aright: no man repented him of his wickedness, saying, What have I done? every one turned to his course, as the horse rusheth into the battle.
verses.ct: I listened carefully, but they never said the right thing. Not one person felt sorry for their wickedness or asked, 'What have I done?' Each one charges ahead on their own path, like a horse rushing into battle.

verses.kjv: Yea, the stork in the heaven knoweth her appointed times; and the turtle and the crane and the swallow observe the time of their coming; but my people know not the judgment of the LORD.
verses.ct: Even the stork in the heavens knows its migration seasons. The turtledove, the swift, and the swallow all follow their appointed times. But my people don't understand the requirements of the LORD.

verses.kjv: How do ye say, We are wise, and the law of the LORD is with us? Lo, certainly in vain made he it; the pen of the scribes is in vain.
verses.ct: How can you claim, 'We are wise, and we have the law of the LORD'? Look — the lying pen of the scribes has turned it into something false.

verses.kjv: The wise men are ashamed, they are dismayed and taken: lo, they have rejected the word of the LORD; and what wisdom is in them?
verses.ct: These so-called wise people will be humiliated, thrown into panic and trapped. Look — they have rejected the word of the LORD, so what kind of wisdom do they really have?

verses.kjv: Therefore will I give their wives unto others, and their fields to them that shall inherit them: for every one from the least even unto the greatest is given to covetousness, from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.
verses.ct: Because of this, I will hand their wives over to other men and their fields to new owners. Everyone, from the lowest to the highest, is consumed by greed. From prophet to priest, every one of them practices deception.

verses.kjv: For they have healed the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.
verses.ct: They treat the wounds of my people as if they were nothing serious, saying, 'Everything is fine, everything is fine!' — when nothing is fine at all.

verses.kjv: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore shall they fall among them that fall: in the time of their visitation they shall be cast down, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: Were they embarrassed when they did such disgusting things? No, they felt no shame whatsoever — they didn't even know how to blush. So they will collapse along with everyone else who falls. When I come to hold them accountable, they will be brought down," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: I will surely consume them, saith the LORD: there shall be no grapes on the vine, nor figs on the fig tree, and the leaf shall fade; and the things that I have given them shall pass away from them.
verses.ct: "I will completely destroy them," declares the LORD. "There will be no grapes on the vine and no figs on the fig tree. Even the leaves will wither. Everything I gave them will be taken away."

verses.kjv: Why do we sit still? assemble yourselves, and let us enter into the defenced cities, and let us be silent there: for the LORD our God hath put us to silence, and given us water of gall to drink, because we have sinned against the LORD.
verses.ct: "Why are we just sitting here? Let's gather together and retreat into the fortified cities. Let us die in silence there, because the LORD our God has condemned us to death. He has given us poisoned water to drink because we sinned against the LORD.

verses.kjv: We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of health, and behold trouble!
verses.ct: We hoped for peace, but nothing good came. We waited for a time of healing, but instead there was disaster!

verses.kjv: The snorting of his horses was heard from Dan: the whole land trembled at the sound of the neighing of his strong ones; for they are come, and have devoured the land, and all that is in it; the city, and those that dwell therein.
verses.ct: The snorting of their horses can be heard all the way from Dan. The whole land shakes at the sound of their stallions neighing. They have arrived and are devouring the land and everything in it — the cities and all who live there."

verses.kjv: For, behold, I will send serpents, cockatrices, among you, which will not be charmed, and they shall bite you, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I am sending venomous snakes among you, vipers that cannot be charmed, and they will strike you," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: When I would comfort myself against sorrow, my heart is faint in me.
verses.ct: My grief is beyond healing; my heart is sick inside me.

verses.kjv: Behold the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people because of them that dwell in a far country: Is not the LORD in Zion? is not her king in her? Why have they provoked me to anger with their graven images, and with strange vanities?
verses.ct: Listen! The cries of my people ring out from a distant land: "Isn't the LORD in Zion? Isn't her King still there?" — "Why have they provoked me with their carved idols and their worthless foreign gods?"

verses.kjv: The harvest is past, the summer is ended, and we are not saved.
verses.ct: "The harvest season is over, the summer has ended, and still we are not rescued."

verses.kjv: For the hurt of the daughter of my people am I hurt; I am black; astonishment hath taken hold on me.
verses.ct: I am crushed because my people are crushed. I am in mourning; horror has gripped me.

verses.kjv: Is there no balm in Gilead; is there no physician there? why then is not the health of the daughter of my people recovered?
verses.ct: Is there no healing medicine in Gilead? Is there no doctor there? Then why hasn't the health of my people been restored?
